meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a smallpox pustule.
meanings.sent1: The variolar rash on his skin was a clear sign of the illness.
meanings.sent2: The doctor identified the variolar marks on the patient's body.
meanings.sent3: The variolar spots on the wall looked like tiny volcanoes erupting.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was variolar, bubbling up slowly before erupting in a fiery outburst.
meanings.sent5: The variolar appearance of the rash made it easily recognizable to the trained eye.

meanings.sent1: The variolar on his arm was painful and itchy.
meanings.sent2: The nurse carefully examined the variolar on the child's face.
meanings.sent3: The variolar seemed to have a personality of its own, growing bigger each day.
meanings.sent4: The variolar was like a tiny enemy invading his body.
meanings.sent5: The variolar oozed with pus, a clear sign of the infection.
